evidence.text: NOTICE OF APPEAL as to 40 Terminate Deadlines and Hearings,,, Order,,, Order Vacating,,, Terminate Motions,, by David Mountain Chief, Rhonda Mountain Chief, Jonathan St. Goddard, Susan Webber. Filing fee $605, receipt number BMTDC-3471717.

extracted.value: David Mountain Chief, Rhonda Mountain Chief, Jonathan St. Goddard, Susan Webber appealed to U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit (Case No. 25-2717).

evidence.text: IT IS ORDERED that Defendants' Motion to Transfer to the United States Court of International Trade (Doc. 18) is GRANTED. This case shall be transferred to the United States Court of International Trade pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1631. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendants' Motion to Stay (Doc. 20) pending resolution of the Motion to Transfer is DENIED AS MOOT. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the hearing set for May 1, 2025, is VACATED.

extracted.value: The court granted Defendants' Motion to Transfer to the U.S. Court of International Trade on April 25, 2025, vacating the May 1, 2025 hearing.

evidence.text: ORDER denying 42 Motion for Preliminary Injunction Pending Appeal.

evidence.text: MOTION for Preliminary and Permanent Injunction. Monica Tranel appearing for Plaintiffs Jonathan St. Goddard, Susan Webber.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs Jonathan St. Goddard and Susan Webber filed a Motion for Preliminary and Permanent Injunction on April 4, 2025, seeking to halt enforcement of executive orders pending resolution of the case.

evidence.text: MOTION for Reconsideration Final Order Doc. 40. Monica Tranel appearing for Plaintiffs David Mountain Chief, Rhonda Mountain Chief, Jonathan St. Goddard, Susan Webber.

extracted.value: Plaintiffs filed a Motion for Reconsideration of the Court's Order granting the Motion to Transfer on April 28, 2025.

evidence.text: ORDER Setting Hearing re MOTION 3 for Preliminary and Permanent Injunction filed by Jonathan St. Goddard and Susan Webber. Motion Hearing set for 5/1/2025 at 01:30 PM in Great Falls, MT before Judge Dana L. Christensen. Signed by Judge Dana L. Christensen on 4/10/2025.

IT IS ORDERED that Defendants' Motion to Transfer to the United States Court of International Trade (Doc. 18) is GRANTED. This case shall be transferred to the United States Court of International Trade pursuant to 28 U.S.C. § 1631. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Defendants' Motion to Stay (Doc. 20) pending resolution of the Motion to Transfer is DENIED AS MOOT. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the hearing set for May 1, 2025, is VACATED.

extracted.value: The court scheduled a hearing for May 1, 2025, regarding the Motion for Preliminary and Permanent Injunction (Event 14), but the hearing was vacated on April 25, 2025, following the court's order granting the Motion to Transfer (Event 40).
